byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Greenville, S.C.
byline.original: By NOAM SCHEIBER and AMY CHOZICK

abstract: International Assn of Firefighters, one of most powerful unions in United States, backs away from initial plans to endorse Hillary Rodham Clinton for president; several unions have reconsidered endorsing Clinton in light of potential challenges from Vice Pres Joe Biden and Sen Bernie Sanders.
lead_paragraph: The International Association of Fire Fighters was influenced by the possible Democratic candidacy of Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., as well as rank-and-file members’ discomfort with Mrs. Clinton.

headline.main: Firefighters’ Union Backs Away From Endorsement of Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Firefighters’ Union Backs Away From Endorsement of Clinton

snippet: The International Association of Fire Fighters was influenced by the possible Democratic candidacy of Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., as well as rank-and-file members’ discomfort with Mrs. Clinton.
